Citation_Information.author_list: St. Clair, M; Million, C.; Siegler, M.
Citation_Information.description: This table contains data from 1971-1974 for the lower gradient bridge of Apollo 15 probe 2 in this bundle's 'clean' format. This format flags impulsive outliers and missing data using a bitmask, adds a corrected dT range to some Lamont-NSSDC data, reorders some inverted time points, and places data from Nagihara et al. into the format of the Lamont-NSSDC data. See bundle_documentation.md for details. It is basically a corrected and marked-up version of PDS3 product A15A-L-HFE-3-THERMAL-CONDUCTIVITY-V1.0:A15_HFE_P2_2-201201.

Table_Character.name: a15p2f2
Table_Character.description: This table contains data from 1971-1974 for the upper gradient bridge of Apollo 15 probe 2 in this bundle's 'clean' format. This format flags impulsive outliers and missing data using a bitmask, adds a corrected dT range to some Lamont-NSSDC data, reorders some inverted time points, and places data from Nagihara et al. into the format of the Lamont-NSSDC data. See bundle_documentation.md for details. It is basically a corrected and marked-up version of PDS3 product A15A-L-HFE-3-THERMAL-CONDUCTIVITY-V1.0:A15_HFE_P2_1-201202.

Field_Character.name: Time
Field_Character.description: Earth-received time expressed in the 'mission epoch' format used by the original investigators: total ms from midnight on December 31, 1970.

Field_Character.name: T
Field_Character.description: Average temperature of the bridge's thermometers.

Field_Character.name: dT
Field_Character.description: Temperature difference between the lower and upper thermometers of the bridge. Positive values mean the lower thermometer is warmer. Note that most and perhaps all values in this set are 'saturated' -- soft-clipped at the instrument's dT maximums, +20/-30K -- and do not directly correspond to physical reality.

Field_Character.name: dT_corr
Field_Character.description: Temperature difference between the lower and upper thermometers of the bridge, corrected to remove numerical errors in the source set. Positive values mean the lower thermometer is warmer. Note that most and perhaps all values in this set are 'saturated' -- soft-clipped at the instrument's dT maximums, +20/-30K -- and do not directly correspond to physical reality.

Field_Character.name: flags
Field_Character.description: Bitmask marking special features of some data points. See bundle_documentation.md for details.
